components.description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-left, or south-west direction.
components.title: South West Arrow

description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-left, or south-west direction.
title: South West Arrow

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-left, or south-west direction. Down-left Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the http://emojipedia.org/south-west-arrow/
emoji_net_data.name: down-left arrow

bn:13612752a: Between the cardinal directions, as for example southwest between south and west.

bn:00103572a: Used of the language of the deaf

bn:00105834a: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north
The opposite of right; toward the west when one is facing north.
The west side of the body when one is facing north.

bn:00101423a: Showing the way by conducting or leading; imposing direction on

bn:00073013n: One of the four principal compass points, specifically 90°, conventionally directed to the right on maps. The direction of the rising sun.
One of the four major compass points, specifically 180°, directed toward the South Pole, and conventionally downwards on a map.
The direction corresponding to the southwestward compass point

The four cardinal directions or cardinal points are the directions of north, east, south, and west, commonly denoted by their initials: N, E, S, W. East and west are at right angles to north and south, with east being in the clockwise direction of rotation from north and west being directly opposite east.
One of the four principal compass points, specifically 90, conventionally directed to the right on maps; the direction of the rising sun at an equinox.
One of the four major compass points, specifically 180, directed toward the South Pole, and conventionally downwards on a map.
Directions of north, east, south, and west

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).
